name: C. Similar Pairs
statement:
We call two numbers x and y if they have the same parity (the same
remainder when divided by 2), or if |x-y|=1. For example, in each of the
pairs (2, 6), (4, 3), (11, 7), the numbers are similar to each other,
and in the pairs (1, 4), (3, 12), they are not.You are given an array a
of n (n is even) positive integers. Check if there is such a partition
of the array into pairs that each element of the array belongs to
exactly one pair and the numbers in each pair are similar to each
other.For example, for the array a = [11, 14, 16, 12], there is a
partition into pairs (11, 12) and (14, 16). The numbers in the first
pair are similar because they differ by one, and in the second pair
because they are both even.
